data.name: Kabul Chronicles: A Timeless Capital Journey

touristSpots.name: Babur Gardens (Bagh-e Babur)
touristSpots.description: A historical garden built by Emperor Babur in the 16th century, beautifully restored and offering a peaceful view of Kabul.

touristSpots.name: Kabul Museum (National Museum of Afghanistan)
touristSpots.description: One of the oldest museums in Central Asia, housing ancient artifacts from the Greek, Buddhist, and Islamic periods.

touristSpots.name: Darul Aman Palace
touristSpots.description: A grand European-style palace built in the 1920s, symbolizing Afghanistan’s modernization and resilience.

touristSpots.name: Shah-Do Shamshira Mosque
touristSpots.description: A unique yellow mosque in downtown Kabul, known for its Baroque-style architecture and historical significance.

accommodation.3__stars: Mövenpick Hotel Apartments Al Mamzar Dubai

data.name: Bamyan Wonders: Valley of Legendary Beauty

touristSpots.name: Buddhas of Bamiyan
touristSpots.description: The remains of two giant Buddha statues carved into the cliffs, once among the largest in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

touristSpots.name: Band-e Amir National Park
touristSpots.description: Afghanistan’s first national park, famous for its stunning blue lakes surrounded by majestic mountains.

touristSpots.name: Shahr-e Gholghola (City of Screams)
touristSpots.description: The ancient ruins of a city destroyed by Genghis Khan, offering a panoramic view over the Bamiyan valley.

touristSpots.name: Dragon Valley (Darya-e Azhdaha)
touristSpots.description: A natural rock formation resembling a dragon, surrounded by legends and beautiful landscapes.

data.name: Paktia Trails: The Heart of Mountain Serenity

touristSpots.name: Gardiz City Park
touristSpots.description: A popular recreational park in the center of Gardiz, where families gather for picnics and relaxation.

touristSpots.name: Shahzada Masjid (Prince Mosque)
touristSpots.description: One of the main mosques in Gardiz, known for its traditional Afghan-Islamic architecture.

touristSpots.name: Zazi Aryob Mountains
touristSpots.description: A scenic mountain range near Gardiz, perfect for hiking and exploring the natural beauty of Paktia province.

touristSpots.name: Sardawaza Fort
touristSpots.description: An ancient fort located on a hill overlooking Gardiz, offering a glimpse into the region’s historical defense structures.

data.name: Balkh Heritage: Echoes of the Ancient Silk Road

touristSpots.name: Blue Mosque (Shrine of Hazrat Ali)
touristSpots.description: A stunning mosque in Mazar-i-Sharif, famous for its blue tiles and as a sacred site believed to house the tomb of Hazrat Ali.

touristSpots.name: Balkh Ancient City
touristSpots.description: Ruins of one of the oldest cities in the world, known as the 'Mother of Cities', with historical monuments and archaeological sites.

touristSpots.name: Mazar Garden
touristSpots.description: A peaceful garden near the city center, ideal for relaxation and enjoying the local culture.

touristSpots.name: Ariana Afghan Airlines Monument
touristSpots.description: A historical monument commemorating Afghan aviation, located near Mazar-i-Sharif airport.

data.name: Herat Splendor: A Journey Through Persian Artistry

touristSpots.name: Herat Grand Mosque (Jame Mosque of Herat)
touristSpots.description: One of the oldest and most beautiful mosques in Afghanistan, famous for its stunning blue tiles and Islamic architecture.

touristSpots.name: Citadel of Herat (Qala Ikhtyaruddin)
touristSpots.description: An ancient fortress built during Alexander the Great’s time, offering panoramic views of Herat city.

touristSpots.name: Gawhar Shad Mausoleum (Musalla Complex)
touristSpots.description: A masterpiece of Timurid architecture, built by Queen Gawhar Shad in the 15th century.

touristSpots.name: Khwaja Abdullah Ansari Shrine (Gazar Gah)
touristSpots.description: The sacred shrine of the famous Sufi saint Khwaja Abdullah Ansari, located on a hill outside Herat.

data.name: Kandahar Legacy: Land of Kings and Traditions

touristSpots.name: Shrine of Hazrat Ali (Blue Mosque of Kandahar)
touristSpots.description: A sacred Islamic shrine in Kandahar, believed to house the tomb of Hazrat Ali, famous for its beautiful blue tiles.

touristSpots.name: Kandahar Citadel (Qala-e-Kandahar)
touristSpots.description: A historic fortress in the city center, serving as a symbol of Kandahar’s rich history and strategic importance.

touristSpots.name: Mausoleum of Ahmad Shah Durrani
touristSpots.description: The resting place of the founder of modern Afghanistan, located in a beautifully designed garden.

touristSpots.name: Registan Garden
touristSpots.description: A historic and scenic garden in Kandahar, popular for relaxation and cultural gatherings.

data.name: Nuristan Mystique: Into the Forested Highlands

touristSpots.name: Kamdesh Valley
touristSpots.description: A stunning valley surrounded by high mountains and rivers, perfect for trekking and exploring nature.

touristSpots.name: Waygal Valley
touristSpots.description: A beautiful valley known for its lush forests, traditional Nuristani villages, and scenic landscapes.

touristSpots.name: Nuristani Museum (Parun)
touristSpots.description: A museum showcasing the unique culture, history, and artifacts of the Nuristani people.

touristSpots.name: Pej Valley
touristSpots.description: A picturesque valley famous for its rivers, forests, and traditional wooden architecture of Nuristan.

data.name: Badakhshan Majesty: Roof of the World Expedition

touristSpots.name: Wakhan Corridor
touristSpots.description: A narrow strip of land surrounded by high mountains, famous for its stunning landscapes and unique culture.

touristSpots.name: Fayzabad Bazaar
touristSpots.description: The central market of Badakhshan, vibrant with local trade, handicrafts, and traditional Afghan culture.

touristSpots.name: Baharak Valley
touristSpots.description: A scenic valley known for its rivers, orchards, and peaceful rural life.

touristSpots.name: Ishkashim Border Area
touristSpots.description: A picturesque border area with beautiful views of the Panj River and neighboring Tajikistan.
